labels.comment: Main label - UPDATE source_field to match your data

descriptions.default: federally recognized tribe in Alaska, United States
descriptions.comment: Description - UPDATE source_field to match your data

claims.comment: instance of - Must have exactly one P31 matching Q7840353 with stated in reference - type to which this subject corresponds/belongs. Different from P279 (subclass of); for example: K2 is an instance of mountain; volcano is a subclass of mountain

references.comment: Stated in: 2024 Federal Register Notice of Indian Entities Recognized and Eligible To Receive Services From the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs

claims.comment: continent - Continent: North America - continent of which the subject is a part

references.name: inferred from hq location
references.comment: based on heuristic - inferred from headquarters location

claims.comment: country - Country: United States (allow others for Tribes that cross nation boundaries) - sovereign state that this item is in (not to be used for human beings)

inception - Inception (date of establishment, generally from the perspective of the governmental entity interacting with the United States) - time when an entity begins to exist; for date of official opening use P1619
member count - Member count - number of entities that are part of an organization at a particular time
native label - Native label - label for the items in their official language or their original language

official website - Official website - URL of the official page of an item (current or former). Usage: If a listed URL no longer points to the official website, do not remove it, but see the "Hijacked or dead websites" section of the Talk page
headquarters location - Headquarters location - city or town where an organization's headquarters is or has been situated. Use P276 qualifier for specific building

image - Image representative of the tribe - image of relevant illustration of the subject; if available, also use more specific properties (sample: coat of arms image, locator map, flag image, signature image, logo image, collage image)
flag image - Official flag image for the tribe - image of the item's flag
seal image - Official seal image for the tribe - image of subject's seal (emblem)
locator map image - Locator map image that shows the location of the tribe relative to a larger area - geographic map image which highlights the location of the subject within some larger entity
foundational text - Item representing the foundational text for the tribe such as a constitution - text through which an institution or object has been created or established
has part(s) - Parts of the tribe such as subdivisions or associated entities - part of this subject; inverse property of "part of" (P361). See also "has parts of the class" (P2670).

part of - The tribe as a part of another entity such as a confederation - object of which the subject is a part (if this subject is already part of object A which is a part of object B, then please only make the subject part of object A), inverse property of "has part" (P527, see also "has parts of the class" (P2670))
office held by head of government - Office held by head of government - political office that is fulfilled by the head of the government of this item
office held by head of state - Office held by head of state - political office that is fulfilled by the head of state of this item
head of government - Head of government - head of the executive power of this town, city, municipality, state, country, or other governmental body
head of state - Head of state - official with the highest formal authority in a country/state
topic's main category - Topic's main category - main Wikimedia category
related category - Category related to list - Wikimedia category is related to this item

notes: This mapping was auto-generated from a ShEx schema
UPDATE all 'source_field' values to match your data
ADD appropriate references to claims (use reference_library entries)
UPDATE reference_library with actual source QIDs and URLs
ADD fixed-value claims (instance of, continent, country) with 'value' instead of 'source_field'
For repeated references, use library entry names (e.g., 'basic_reference') instead of inline dicts
